item.title: Report X-2025040660
item.description:
Report X-2025040660

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: SAUK VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ARCBEST INTERNATIONAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Chris Zavala, 034 Operations Manager, contacted Safety regarding a UN3265 spill on the pallet located on the dock. Chris Zavala advised Brandon Nelson unloaded the freight and as was moving the freight down the dock. Chris Zavala stated Edgar Terrazas was also moving freight down the dock when Edgar Terrazas freight punctured the pallet Brandon Nelson was moving. Chris Zavala advised he received conflicting statements from both employees of who damaged the freight. Safety advised Chris Zavala CURA will be contacted for remediation. Chris Zavala requested straight time remediation. Chris Zavala advised the spill is contained and the jug is turned over on it's side to stop the spill. Ariana Lopez with CURA was contacted for remediation on straight time.

item.title: Report E-2025040223
item.description:
Report E-2025040223

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1730 ET, XPO-XLA notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 4-5oz of Clethodim 2e released from a plastic tote due to improper loading (strap rubbed on the tote causing a release). The release impacted the concrete dock and inside trailer#317-8081. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 4 to 5 ounces of UN1993 Clethodim 2e product released from the plastic tote due to a strap rubbing on the corner. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into (2) 200-gallon poly/UV totes due to the excess product. The old tote was triple rinsed and is now considered RCRA empty. Contractors placed impacted PPE in (1) 55-gallon metal drum and impacted oil dry in another (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025040222
item.description:
Report E-2025040222

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: CREST HILL
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of material released from one (1) 5-gallon plastic pail in a box due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pail being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. One (1) 15-gallon poly drum and one (1) 5-gallon poly drum were used to containerize the product. An additional 5-gallon poly drum was used to contain fiber cardboard impacted waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025040759
item.description:
Report X-2025040759

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE WEST PRIMKARY AT BAY 84. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE THE LEAKING PACKAGES AND OTHER MATERIAL. PACKAGES AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFORMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF HAZMAT, CONTENTS WAS SOILED AND THEREFORE SOLIDIFIED. THE MATERIAL WAS BAGGED, MEASURED, WEIGHED AND INFORMATION WAS ENTERED INTO THE DMP/ETT SYSTEM.

item.title: Report E-2025040092
item.description:
Report E-2025040092

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0146 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XLA. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of V716-D was released from a 5-gallon bladder in a box due to improper loading by terminal XDP. The release impacted the inside of the box only in trailer # 3214991. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Chemtrec and spoke to John. Report #2025030700009.
